meanings.definition: A unit used to express the intensity of a sound or the power level of an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the sound using a decibel.
meanings.sent2: The concert was so loud that it reached a high decibel level.
meanings.sent3: The decibel whispered secrets to the microphone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a decibel of joy.
meanings.sent5: The decibel of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.

meanings.definition: A measure of the relative loudness of a sound.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the concept of decibel to the students.
meanings.sent2: The decibel of the alarm clock woke me up early.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the decibel of the purring machine.
meanings.sent4: His voice carried a decibel of authority that demanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The decibel of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
